newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: INTERVIEW - Benpres seeks niche in utilities.
newsitem.headline: INTERVIEW - Benpres seeks niche in utilities.

text.p: Benpres Holdings Corp which has interests in power distribution and telcommunications now wants to spread further into utilities by getting into the water business, the firm's chief operating officer said.
Benpres was hoping to win a concession to privatise Manila's water works system, J.Xavier Gonzales told Reuters in an interview on Wednesday.
"We have made a financially plausible bid that will deliver value to the Filipino consumer with value being defined as lower price than today and full coverage," Gonzales added.
The Manila Waterworks and Sewerage System (MWSS) has invited bidders for two 25-year concessions to operate the utility.

Benpres, which put in a bid jointly with France's Lyonnaise des Eaux SA, is one of four consortia that are vying for the contract. The MWSS said the bids of all the four contenders were technically in order and was due to open the financial bids on Thursday.

"Our bid for the MWSS is consistent with our public service thrust and the fact that we are in public utilities and that we are able to deliver good value to consumers in the businesses that we are in," Gonzales said.
Gonzales said Benpres was seen posting a net profit of around 2.0 billion pesos in 1996, up 25 percent from the year-ago figure.
Net profits in 1997 were seen at about 2.5 billion pesos, he said.
The biggest earner in the Benpres group is television broadcaster ABS-CBN Corp which claims about 70 percent of the country's television audience.
Its other holdings include Philippine Commercial International Bank, Manila Electric Co, ICC Telecoms and a property development firm.
